comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

I don't know why my last toke was being removed !!!!!

The problem is, when Firefox try to access the JSF based site, through HTTPS, a lot of problem occur and Firefox cannot render the page correctly. Sometimes just cannot locate the CSS (actually the CSS was there, FireFox error console report that the MIME type is not correct but actually everything is fine). Sometime the whole page was not display but only some of the image of the page. Sometime the HTML was downloaded and verified by Ctrl-U to view the code, but FireFox just cannot display it correctly.

It will be better using HTTP only but not HTTPS, same problem still occur but not as much as using HTTPS.

IE and Chrome both check with HTTPS and HTTP don't have any problem.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Just surf around the site will get the page display incorrectly
2.
3.
comments.author: ivanyiu@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

I don't know why my last toke was being removed !!!!!

The problem is, when Firefox try to access the JSF based site, through HTTPS, a lot of problem occur and Firefox cannot render the page correctly. Sometimes just cannot locate the CSS (actually the CSS was there, FireFox error console report that the MIME type is not correct but actually everything is fine). Sometime the whole page was not display but only some of the image of the page. Sometime the HTML was downloaded and verified by Ctrl-U to view the code, but FireFox just cannot display it correctly.

It will be better using HTTP only but not HTTPS, same problem still occur but not as much as using HTTPS.

IE and Chrome both check with HTTPS and HTTP don't have any problem.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Just surf around the site will get the page display incorrectly
2.
3.
